greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lower triangular region of array A286156, transposed.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10585; the first 145 rows of the triangle
example: The first ten rows of this triangular array:
mathematica: Map[((#1 + #2)^2 + 3 #1 + #2)/2 & @@ # & /@ Reverse@ # &, Table[Reverse@ QuotientRemainder[n, k], {n, 14}, {k, n}]] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 20 2017 *)
program: def T(a, b): return ((a + b)**2 + 3*a + b)/2
def a(n, k): return T(n%k, int(n/k))
for n in range(1, 21): print [a(n , k) for k in range(1, n + 1)][::-1]  # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 20 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 04 2017
